sentence.Network_en: Historical evidence lends credence to his theory.
sentence.Network_cn: 史学根据使他的理论更为可信。

sentence.Network_en: Her denials of this charge served merely to lend it credence.
sentence.Network_cn: 她对这一指控的矢口否认,反倒更使人相信这一指控是真的.

sentence.Network_en: It is strictly forbidden to obtain confessions and to give them credence.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from medieval Latin credentia, from Latin credent- 'believing', from the verb credere

entry.tran: (理论或故事的)可信性，真实性
entry.def: If something lends or gives credence to a theory or story, it makes it easier to believe.

example.ex: Good studies are needed to lend credence to the notion that genuine progress can be made in this important field.
example.tran: 需要进行认真的研究，以让人们相信在这一重要领域可以取得真正的进展。

entry.def: If you give credence to a theory or story, you believe it.

example.ex: You're surely not giving any credence to this story of Hythe's?
example.tran: 你肯定不会相信海斯的说法吧？

means.word_mean: 1. the mental attitude that something is believable and should be accepted as true;

sentences.sentence: "acceptance of Newtonian mechanics was unquestioned for 200 years"

means.word_mean: 2. a kind of sideboard or buffet

auth_sentence.content: My experiments give some decent credence to this possibility.
auth_sentence.res_content: My experiments give some decent credence to this possibility.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My experiments give some decent credence to this possibility.

auth_sentence.content: It can also lend credence to multiple universes.
auth_sentence.res_content: It can also lend credence to multiple universes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It can also lend credence to multiple universes.

auth_sentence.content: This programme seemed almost too agreeable for credence.
auth_sentence.res_content: This programme seemed almost too agreeable for credence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This programme seemed almost too agreeable for credence.

stems_affixes.word_buile: cred相信+ible能……的→adj.可靠的,可信的
cred相信,信任+ulous多……的→相信太多→轻信的
in不+credulous[adj.轻信的,易信的]→adj.怀疑的, 不轻信的
cred相信,信任+it表抽象名词→ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分
cred相信,信任+ential表形容词或名词→让人相信的东西→凭据
credulous[[adj.轻信的,易信的]]→n.易信, 轻信
cred相信,信任+it表抽象名词→ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分
ac给予+credit[ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分]→给予相信→委托
dis不+credit[ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分]→v.不信任,怀疑

sentences.en: Her denials of this charge served merely to lend it credence.
sentences.cn: 她对这一指控的矢口否认,反倒更使人相信这一指控是真的。
